Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Abaloparatide for Bone Health Optimization in Postmenopausal Women Undergoing Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: This Phase-3, double-blinded, placebo-controlled trial included 500 postmenopausal women

Participants.evidence: 500 postmenopausal women with osteoporosis from the ACTIVE trial

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive abaloparatide (n=250) or placebo (n=250) for 18 months.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of abaloparatide on BMD in proximal femoral regions.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in integral volumetric BMD in Gruen zones over 18 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by study site and race/ethnicity, with allocation concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive abaloparatide (n=250) or placebo (n=250)

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 6 and 18 months, the abaloparatide group showed greater increases in integral volumetric BMD in all zones compared to placebo (p<0.005).

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported.
